sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the School Health Center Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the School Health Center Act.

sections.heading: Legislative findings. The General Assembly finds as follows:
sections.text: Legislative findings. The General Assembly finds as follows:

sections.heading: Eligibility. All students in the school under the age of 18 are eligible for services if they have obtained written parental consent or if they are otherwise permitted under Illinois law to consent on their own behalf to such care
sections.text: All students 18 years of age or older are eligible for the services.

sections.heading: Consent. The school health center shall provide a list of the health care services available
sections.text: The form shall enumerate the provided services using either a check off or other means. The consent form shall state that a parent, legal guardian, or student who is permitted under Illinois law to consent

sections.heading: Department of Human Services to initiate school health centers
sections.text: Subject to appropriation, the Illinois Department of Human Services shall initiate 20 new school health centers over a 5-year period beginning July 1, 2007, and shall build capacity with existing school health centers in the State of Il

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
